title: Metric’s Emily Haines rocks runway in design collaboration with Montreal’s Rudsak
text:
by Lauren La Rose, The Canadian Press Posted Oct 22, 2015 7:00 am EDT 
TORONTO – Metric frontwoman Emily Haines may be in the midst of a European tour, but she’s still finding a way to rock the runway back at home in Toronto. 
The indie rock singer-songwriter has teamed with Canadian brand Rudsak on a special design collaboration that will be unveiled during Toronto’s World MasterCard Fashion Week on Thursday. 
Haines said she was approached by the Montreal-based leather goods retailer to create a custom piece for the brand. She teamed with Rudsak founder and head designer Evik Asatoorian in designing a limited-edition leather jacket. 
“For me, the Rudsak collaboration is all about creating something for the modern woman who has to live life on Earth — not on stage,” Haines said in a phone interview from Berlin. 
“And the jacket that we’ve designed is as suitable for a working professional woman, or a mother, or a rock ‘n’ roller. It’s not about showing off. It’s about function and elegance.” 
Haines said she came to the process with “zero experience,” but wasn’t surprised to see the level of care required to design a new garment. 
“That’s true, I think, for every craft. But it was amazing to see how Evik works and to see the huge spectrum of fabrics and materials and options, and the qualities of the leathers that they’re using and all the workmanship…. My idea, I thought, was maybe a bit out there. But Evik was really excited and got behind it right away.” 
Asatoorian said Haines’s rock star image was the ideal fit with the label, which has prided itself on its “cool rebel” signature look after two decades in business. 
“We started looking at her lifestyle, what are a true rock star’s needs, and what does she wish to have,” he said. “She’s so talented —not only for music but even taste-wise. 
“It’s nice to know when a person says what her true passion on a product is … and she looks at it from outside the box.” 
Haines’s inaugural foray into fashion comes on the heels of Metric’s latest full-length album “Pagans In Vegas,” released last month.
